To the Editor: I quickly grabbed the Travel section when I saw the feature on spas with new age amenities (''Feel the Burn? It's More of a Glow,'' March 5). On a cold, rainy Sunday morning I was ready for exactly this type of escape. But I was distressed to see the suggestion by the Women's Travel Club that it was cheaper to throw away T-shirts than have them laundered (''Plotting a Spa Getaway'').

This sort of thinking is reminiscent of the ''old age'' values that supported our society's throwaway mentality and its view that it was convenient and natural to use the earth as a receptacle for our unwanted goods. I would have preferred to see more earth-friendly suggestions, such as rinsing out the shirts, giving them away or taking them home.
